catalogue_raissonne: Hollstein, Timmers 16; not in Le Blanc
description: Jupiter as a satyr (his PR animal leg faintly visible in deep shadow) with his PR arm around the hips of sleeping nude Antiope, with her arms above her head; oil lamp and tambourine, ULC; curtain behind figures' heads; tree, ULQ
inscription:
Inscription

LRC, in pencil: [694]; on back at bottom edge, in pencil: [G. de Lairesse, (illegible)]
provenance: [Frederick Mulder Old Master & Modern Prints, London, until 1985; sold in November for SOO, to Harry Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1985-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Jupiter and Antiope
